content.description: Another phenomenal route on the Meader wall at Grandads Bluff.  Vertical to overhanging. Very powerful climb, perhaps harder than Brown Reason?
content.location: Just to the left of Micro Putz.  Or the second route on the right.

climbs.name: Patent Pending
climbs.fa: Corey Morris (group cred FA, see below)

content.description: Starts on the far left side of the bluff. Follow first four bolts to some big huecos. The climb is pretty straightforward to here. The next couple of moves between the fourth and fifth bolts are very sequency. Look for a crystal pocket just below the fifth bolt. After clipping the fifth bolt continue along through a cave to the sixth bolt and the anchor. Watch for loose rock.
content.protection: Six bolts to the top. Hanging chains for anchors.

content.description: This route moves up the large flake and into some small holds just below the right most hueco on patent pending. Avoid traversing far left into Patent Pending. Instead set up for a huge full body length dyno from the crimps into the hueco, then finish through the crux of Man in the Black PJ's.

Easy 5.10 climbing leads to a rest ledge at the second bolt. Take a good rest cause its business from here to the top. Progressively more difficult pulls lead you through a hueco to some excellent crystal pockets and finally to easier terrain at the top. Dont let this fool you though, most everyone falls from indecision just past the last bolt. Many equally magninal feet and crimps will surely have you wondering....what was the sequence again? 

  Originally graded 5.12d this route has seen a lot of change due to weathering, general use,  and perhaps "aggressive cleaning", making past difficult moves far easier. Nowadays this is one of the first .12's done by Lax locals.

Furthest right route. Also the shortest. Starts on top of the flat top hill. Being the easiest of the bolted routes at the park, it has been the site of several gumby epics. Climbing outside is not the same as the gym, even if the routes are bolted.

climbs.name: The Man In The Black Pajamas
climbs.fa: FTR JJ Schlick 1994, FL Travis Melin

content.description: Sustained, long, and progressively more powerful pulls on thin holds quickly lead into a burly undercling, and finally a crux stab at a good pocket.  All this made more exciting as the crux throw is made with the bolt below your feet...(dont worry its a good fall:). Rest up in the cave at the top, as there is still a slopey V2 move to get the anchors clipped.
content.location: Between Patent Pending and Brown Reason to Live

content.description: Shares the first two bolts with Microputz then traverses to the left, following a line of weakness to the anchor.
content.protection: 5 bolts with two bolt chain anchor. Anchor can also be accessed off of BMOC or Microputz.

content.description: Best route at Grandads Bluff. Fun, powerful moves on small holds.
content.location: To the left of Pork Tornado.

content.description: Bouldering traverse of the bottom of the Meader wall on ledge system. Good fun. Usually done left to right then back again. Keep going until you're pumped or bored.
Tough route -- very sustained. Has gotten easier over the years as holds have broken.  Aim for the massive hueco up high.  Exiting this "rest" can be tough...

Not a standard route for the wall... as in not sustained. Well defined crux at the small roof (15 foot mark) featuring double, wide horizontal pinches and a stab to a decent hold. Great 5.11 climbing to the anchors.
content.protection: 6 bolts, three bolt anchor with chains
content.location: Located 8 feet right of Pork Tornado

content.description: Overhanging bolted sport climbs on generally big holds with difficulty from 5.10+ to 5.13. The cliff is about 55 feet tall and overhangs by about 4 feet on many of the routes.
